0.cdata!: Algerie - Projet de Developpement de L'electricite

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Project for Algeria is a part
            of the 1974-1977 investment program of Societe nationale de
            l'electricite et du gaz (SONELGAZ) and includes: (a)
            gas turbine plants with a capacity of 120 MW at Algiers; two
            units of 40 MW each of the Bloufarik substation, and one 40
            MW unit at the Bab-ez Zouar substation; (b) a main dispatch
            center in SONELGAZ new head office at Algiers, and district
            dispatch centers at Oran and Annaba; (c) construction of
            three 220 kV substations, six 60 kV substations and one 90
            kV substation; and (d) consulting services for
            reorganization, engineering, a tariff study for electricity,
            and a market/tariff study for gas.
